column18: 07/11/2005: A band of suspected Ramadan Hutu rebels rounded up a group of 30 people, mostly women, and burned them alive in huts in the town of Ntulumamba. The action was thought to serve as a deterrent to civilians considering cooperating with the military. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

column18: 03/29/1998: Hutu Interahamwe militiamen attacked the Kinigi Displaced Peoples' Camp in the Ruhengeri district of Rwanda. Twenty people were killed and 42 were wounded in the attack. In addition, the militiamen freed 29 prisoners from the local authority offices that were next to the camp.
column39: Kinigi Displaced People's Camp in Northern Rwanda
column125: The Hutu rebels also looted property and took livestock during the attack.

column18: 04/03/1998: Suspected members of the Interahamwe Hutu Rebels, slaughtered seven people and three in Rutobwe commune, north of Gitarama town, Rwanda. The victims were all 1994 genocide survivors.

column18: 09/11/1998: A woman was killed and several people were injured in a hand grenade attack at the public transport terminus in Rwanda's capital, Kigali. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

column18: 5/24/2000: Rwandan Hutu rebels raided the hamlet of Rumero, near Gisenyi town, Rwanda.  At least four people were killed in the attack.  The rebels fled to the Congo following the attack.
column64: Specific motive is unknown but authorities state that the rebels often attack those that they believe are working with the authorities
column97: No mention of weapons was made
column125: Sources state that 4-6 people were killed in the attack
column130: 2000.\",\"\"\"At least 4 reportedly slain by Hutu rebels"
column134: in the Gitarama province in the central area of southern Rwanda"
column135: 06/29/2001: Two armed assailants shot at the Joseph Sibomana, mayor of the district of Bonija, as he traveled on a motorcycle in Mt. Ndiza, Gitarama province, Rwanda.  The assailants killed an officer escorting Sibomana and wounded Sibomana.  Although no group claimed responsibility for the attack, the two attackers, ages 13 and 20, were arrested and detained.
column181: Although the specific motive for the attack was unknown, one of the sources notes that rebels known to be Hutus were trying to infiltrate the area.
column242: One of the sources claims that Sibomana was kidnapped and later released, and that a deputy traveling with him was also wounded (making the total number of victims 3), but the other source does not confirm these claims.
column244: mayor wounded by infiltrators in Rwanda

column17: The incident occurred at Virunga National Park
column18: 08/20/2001: A park warden was shot and killed by assailants who were former soldiers in the defeated Rwandan Armed Forces (FAR) and the Hutu extremist Interahamwe militia in Virunga National Park, Rwanda.
column39: Warden of the Virunga National Park
